guide.title: Gentoo Documentation Project Roadmap
guide.abstract: The complete roadmap for the Gentoo Documentation Project

body.note: Please note that this roadmap is dynamic. While the GDP team will try to follow it as much as possible, it is understandable that it could grow or shrink according to changing release schedules and outstanding circumstances.

tr.ti: All GDP/ Gentoo documentation will be licensed under an open license.

The GDP will grow to include developers to actively cover all subprojects within the GDP project. The management structure will grow to incorporate the leaders of all subprojects in the decision making process.

All official documentation, or at the very least, all core documentation, will be translated into all major international languages, defined by, but not limited to French, German, Japanese, Russian, and Dutch.
The Gentoo website should provide a list of all Gentoo community sites. There are some proposals made, amongst them GLEP 10. This localisation requires some changes in website and cvs permissions.
The GDP wil work on creating a Gentoo handbook that features everything users should know about Gentoo Linux, including installation, administration, application usage and development.
Portage will be fully documented. This full documentation will include API documentation, as well as user documentation. The manual pages should also be available online.

body.p: Below you will find more specific information regarding a certain Goal. Every Goal is accompagnied by an individual roadmap. An item in blue is the current status.

The idea is to have all documents available under some kind of open documentation license. Several discussions have emerged since the first proposal, up until the managers meeting from september the 8th where the final decision has been made: all documentation that gentoo provides must be licensed under the Creative Commons - Attribution / Share Alike (CC-BY-SA) license.

body.p: The Gentoo Documentation team needs to be structered in a way that everybody (and especially the other Gentoo developers) know who is part of the documentation team and with what duties.
To accomplish this, a list of all team members must be made public, together with their e-mail address and their duty. A duty can be:

ul.li: Lead Translator: This person is in charge of a language for translated documentation.
Follow-Up Lead Translator: If the Lead Translator is on a hiatus, this person takes over the job.
Subproject Lead: This person is in charge of a GDP Subproject.
Editor / Reviewer: This person edits documents to fix a bugreport or adds enhancements. He/she is also in charge of checking existing bugfixes for their sanity (reviewing of patches).
Strategic Manager: This person is in charge of the long-term vision (and implementation) of the GDP.
Operational Manager: This person is in charge of the daily managerial tasks of the GDP.

body.p: As you probably figured out by now, this project aims to translate all Gentoo documentation into several languages. Every language has its own responsible lead translator in charge of the translation efforts for his language.
Everything about this project is available in GLEP 10.
